wikipedia_page.main: Declan John Galbraith (born 19 December 1991) is a British musician. He is best known for his 2002 hit single,  "Tell Me Why", which peaked at #29 in the UK Singles Chart.

response: Declan Galbraith, best known for his 2002 hit single "Tell Me Why", which peaked at #29 in the UK Singles Chart, is from Hoo.
He was the major songwriter for the English singer Declan Galbraith for his first album Declan (2002), including the hit "Tell Me Why" (No. 29 in UK) and "Till the Day We Meet Again".

"Angels" is Williams' best-selling single and was voted the best song of the previous 25 years at the 2005 Brit Awards. It has been covered by artists including Jessica Simpson, David Archuleta, Beverley Knight, All Angels, Declan Galbraith and Josh Groban. It has been recorded in Spanish (as "Ángel") by Mexican singers Yuridia and Marco Moré, and in Italian (as "Un Angelo") by Patrizio Buanne. Williams also recorded a Spanish version. In a 2005 poll, Britons voted "Angels" the song they most wanted played at their funeral.
* Declan Galbraith, on the album Declan (album) (2002)
* You and Me, by Declan Galbraith, and the title song, 2007

*Alien, a Swedish rock band with Jim Jidhed as lead vocalist, reached number one in Sweden with their cover version. It was also covered by Declan Galbraith on his "Thank You" album and by German actor and singer Uwe Ochsenknecht (simply billed as "Ochsenknecht") in 1992.
Declan is the debut studio album by singer Declan Galbraith. It was released on 22 September 2002 in the United Kingdom, when Galbraith was only 10 years old.
Thank You is the second studio album by English singer Declan Galbraith. It was released on 1 December 2006 in Germany by Starwatch Music.
"Tell Me Why" is a single by English singer Declan Galbraith and 83,637 other children.
